Line 21: Line 21:
==Music career==
==Music career==
â
On December 25, 2009, Tyler, the Creator self-released his first album, ''[[Bastard (album)|Bastard]]''. The album was eventually ranked 32nd on Pitchfork Media's list of the Top Albums of 2010. On February 11, 2011, Tyler released the music video for "[[Yonkers (song)|Yonkers]]", the first single from his second album, ''[[Goblin (album)|Goblin]]'', due to be released May 10, 2011. The video has received attention from several online media outlets.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://rapfix.mtv.com/2011/02/11/tyler-the-creator-gets-odd-in-yonkers/ |title=Tyler, The Creator Gets Odd In âYonkersâ |publisher=Rapfix.mtv.com |date=2011-02-11 |accessdate=2011-02-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.complex.com/music/2011/02/video-tyler-the-creator-yonkers |title=Video: Tyler, The Creator "Yonkers" |publisher=Complex.com |date=2011-02-11 |accessdate=2011-02-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://stereogum.com/636961/tyler-the-creator-yonkers-video/top-stories/lead-story/ |title=Tyler, The Creator â âYonkersâ Video |publisher=Stereogum |date=2011-02-13 |accessdate=2011-02-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spin.com/articles/watch-shocking-clip-odd-future-frontman |title=WATCH: Shocking Clip From Odd Future Frontman |publisher=SPIN.com |date=2011-02-11 |accessdate=2011-02-19}}</ref> An extended version with a third verse can be purchased on [[iTunes]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://itunes.apple.com/us/album/yonkers-single/id419873754 |title=Yonkers - Single by Tyler, The Creator - Download Yonkers - Single on iTunes |publisher=Itunes.apple.com |date=2011-02-14 |accessdate=2011-03-02}}</ref> After the release of "[[Yonkers (song)|Yonkers]]," [[XL Recordings]] announced that Tyler had signed a one-album deal with the label.<ref>{{cite web|last=Cragg |first=Michael |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/music/musicblog/2011/feb/17/tyler-creator-yonkers |title=New music: Tyler, the Creator â Yonkers | Music | guardian.co.uk |publisher=Guardian |date=2010-08-23 |accessdate=2011-02-19}}</ref> Tyler and fellow OFWGKTA member Hodgy Beats made their television debut on February 16, 2011 when they performed "Sandwitches" on ''[[Late Night with Jimmy Fallon]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.latenightwithjimmyfallon.com/video/odd-future-sandwitches/1295865 |title=Odd Future: 'Sandwitches' - Video - NBC.com |publisher=Late Night with Jimmy Fallon |date= |accessdate=2011-02-19}}</ref> On March 16, Tyler and Hodgy performed "[[Yonkers (song)|Yonkers]]" and "Sandwitches" on the 2011 mtvU Woodie Awards, being joined by other members of Odd Future during "Sandwitches". "Goblin" was leaked over the internet on May 4th, 2011 while Tyler was touring in Europe. It was taken off all websites that were manageable to get to.
+
On December 25, 2009, Tyler, the Creator self-released his first album, ''[[Bastard (album)|Bastard]]''. The album was eventually ranked 32nd on Pitchfork Media's list of the Top Albums of 2010. On February 11, 2011, Tyler released the music video for "[[Yonkers (song)|Yonkers]]", the first single from his second album, ''[[Goblin (album)|Goblin]]'', due to be released May 10, 2011. The video has received attention from several online media outlets.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://rapfix.mtv.com/2011/02/11/tyler-the-creator-gets-odd-in-yonkers/ |title=Tyler, The Creator Gets Odd In âYonkersâ |publisher=Rapfix.mtv.com |date=2011-02-11 |accessdate=2011-02-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.complex.com/music/2011/02/video-tyler-the-creator-yonkers |title=Video: Tyler, The Creator "Yonkers" |publisher=Complex.com |date=2011-02-11 |accessdate=2011-02-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://stereogum.com/636961/tyler-the-creator-yonkers-video/top-stories/lead-story/ |title=Tyler, The Creator â âYonkersâ Video |publisher=Stereogum |date=2011-02-13 |accessdate=2011-02-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spin.com/articles/watch-shocking-clip-odd-future-frontman |title=WATCH: Shocking Clip From Odd Future Frontman |publisher=SPIN.com |date=2011-02-11 |accessdate=2011-02-19}}</ref> An extended version with a third verse can be purchased on [[iTunes]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://itunes.apple.com/us/album/yonkers-single/id419873754 |title=Yonkers - Single by Tyler, The Creator - Download Yonkers - Single on iTunes |publisher=Itunes.apple.com |date=2011-02-14 |accessdate=2011-03-02}}</ref> After the release of "[[Yonkers (song)|Yonkers]]," [[XL Recordings]] announced that Tyler had signed a one-album deal with the label.<ref>{{cite web|last=Cragg |first=Michael |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/music/musicblog/2011/feb/17/tyler-creator-yonkers |title=New music: Tyler, the Creator â Yonkers | Music | guardian.co.uk |publisher=Guardian |date=2010-08-23 |accessdate=2011-02-19}}</ref> Tyler and fellow OFWGKTA member Hodgy Beats made their television debut on February 16, 2011 when they performed "Sandwitches" on ''[[Late Night with Jimmy Fallon]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.latenightwithjimmyfallon.com/video/odd-future-sandwitches/1295865 |title=Odd Future: 'Sandwitches' - Video - NBC.com |publisher=Late Night with Jimmy Fallon |date= |accessdate=2011-02-19}}</ref> On March 16, Tyler and Hodgy performed "[[Yonkers (song)|Yonkers]]" and "Sandwitches" on the 2011 mtvU Woodie Awards, being joined by other members of Odd Future during "Sandwitches".
